transcript.title: NATURAL HERITAGE TRUST PROJECTS
transcript.content:
I am delighted to announce today a further $18m investment in

restoring Australia's natural environment.

The projects I announce today will help revitalise our river systems,

restore our agricultural lands and coastal environment and reverse

erosion.

This is another instalment from the $1.25 billion Natural Heritage

Trust, the largest coordinated investment in the environment in Australia's

history.

Our primary industries are closely linked with our environment. A

degraded environment will lead to lower production, lower regional

growth and lower regional employment.

It is important to get the right balance between production and the

environment and this is what lies at the heart of the Natural Heritage

Trust.

The Natural Heritage Trust is an important element in the Government's

determination to rebuild regional Australia. Just as the Commonwealth

is investing in regional infrastructure to support growth, so too

we are investing in the environment and sustainable agriculture to

support regional growth and employment.

(A breakdown of funding across all States is available from Primary

Industries and Energy Minister, John Anderson's Office.)

16 April 1998
